intro: Parosela brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's parosela, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas with rich, loamy soil. Its botanical features include a slender, branched stem and white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Parosela brandegeei is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
